title: Justice Among God’s People
summary: Nehemiah confronts wealthy Jews who were exploiting the poor through debt and slavery. He demands reform and sets an example by refusing personal gain. The people agree and restore fairness.

faq.question: What injustice did Nehemiah address?
faq.answer: The rich were charging interest and enslaving their fellow Jews.

faq.question: What personal example did Nehemiah set?
faq.answer: He refused to take the governor’s food allowance and served sacrificially.
